Signals.Signal: Lower tolerance for heavy owner-dependence; needs a funded 90-day hiring plan or will pass
Signals.Evidence & date: 2026-01-20 — On MSP: "He does three people's jobs... is that the kind of life I want to sign up for? Not really." Modeled hiring 1–2 near-shore roles and using working capital/LOC or higher equity to make it viable; wants a fast go/no-go.
Signals.Coaching move: Show a simple, funded hiring plan (1–2 near-shore/offshore roles) with WC/LOC outlined and a 12–18 month path out of the weeds. Bring pre-vetted candidates and a weekly seller handoff plan.

Signals.Signal: Executes fast once terms feel right; sets cadence immediately
Signals.Evidence & date: 2026-01-06 — LOI fully signed on the healthcare IT + MSP "last Friday," sent the initial doc list the same day, and began setting recurring seller calls.
Signals.Coaching move: When green-lit, send a one-page redline summary and a ready-to-send doc request list; put recurring seller and lender calls on the calendar before ending the call.

Signals.Signal: Parallel-path pragmatist; keeps a real fallback before exiting a deal
Signals.Evidence & date: 2026-01-06 — Will confirm MSP lendability with 2–3 lenders before stepping away from the ABA deal ("have a rock before we jump"); Pathward is still interested on ABA; Live Oak asked for rate trends; Bruce is waiting on balance sheets.
Signals.Coaching move: Line up 2–3 lender intros per path; track term sheets side by side; avoid exclusivity with vendors until a strong term sheet lands.

Signals.Signal: Policy-risk red line on Medicaid-heavy deals; will only proceed if policy risk shifts to the seller note
Signals.Evidence & date: 2025-12-12 — Planned to split a $1.5M seller note: half on full 10-year standby and half performance-based to cushion DSCR. 2026-01-13 — Set end-of-January go/no-go and prepared to re-trade after rate docs. 2026-01-20 — State moved to dismiss Centria v. MercyCare; he will push a re-trade next week and brief Wendy; said he is "mentally checked out" unless terms shift risk.
Signals.Coaching move: Provide plain-English, SBA-compliant language for policy-linked, pro-rata forgiveness; bundle the re-trade after lender term sheets and after fee-schedule proof arrives.

Signals.Signal: Higher privacy guardrails at his W-2; needs low-profile scheduling
Signals.Evidence & date: 2026-01-06 — Employer forced open calendar visibility; he blocked a "lunch" hold so meeting details stay private; wants to exit but will not rush into a bad deal.
Signals.Coaching move: Use generic calendar titles (for example, "Project review"), morning or lunch slots, and concise Slack/DM updates; keep attachments and file names neutral.

Summary (3 bullets max): Preference change: Lower appetite for owner-dependent MSPs unless we can fund 1–2 hires fast (WC/LOC or more equity) with a 90-day handoff plan.
Success pattern: Live-modeling structure and early hires improved comfort; will use lender working capital/LOC to staff quickly.
Psych/coaching note: ABA is time-boxed; pushing a re-trade next week after state’s dismissal motion and rate docs; ready to walk if risk is not shifted.

Action.Top 20 adjustment: Raise MSPs with an existing bench or clear 90-day handoff and a seller who will stay; lower tiny owner-only MSPs; lower AZ Medicaid-heavy ABA/HCBS; keep pure-play ABA with healthier payer mix on the radar.
Action.Sourcing focus next month: MSP/healthcare IT with a basic team and clear handoff; clinic-based ABA with balanced payer mix
